data: Nurse to Initiate Pre Procedure phase of this plan
If BP exceeds the 95% percentile based on the patients height, age and sex
Ensure patient has taken medications before morning labs
Except for Medication, Except for Sips of Water, No food after midnight on night before procedure. May drink clear fluids after midnight until 6 hours prior to procedure (infants 4 hours)
Discontinue nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS), aspirin (ASA) or other anti-platelet medications 10 days before biopsy
Resource and Guidelines for Perioperative Management of Antithrombotic Therapy
Ensure patient has held anticoagulant or antiplatelet medications. If not, notify provider
0.3 mcg/kg, IV, 60 min pre-op, drug form: inj
0.3 mcg/kg, subcutaneous, 60 min pre-op, drug form: inj
If/when CBC, platelet count, INR, PT or PTT not done within past 1 week pre procedure, then nurse to order CBC, platelet count, INR, PT or PTT STAT
Obtain and store aliquots for gross blood
Nurse to Initiate Post Procedure phase of this plan
Post procedure/task/therapy, Discharge 6 hours post procedure (native kidney) if stable (lack of pain, stable BP and no visible hematuria)
Post procedure/task/therapy, Discharge 4 hours post procedure (transplanted kidney) if stable (lack of pain, stable BP and no visible hematuria)
Post procedure/task/therapy, Call nephrologist 4 hours post procedure to obtain discharge order
Discontinue  Pre Procedure phase of the PED NEPH Renal Biopsy (Multiphase) PowerPlan
